title: Space
content: The pronounced differences between Earth and Venus, in spite of their similar orbits and masses, has been one of the biggest puzzles in our solar system.

title: Twitch
content: Data Breach: Documents shared in online forums appear to show records of payments made to streamers.

title: Facebook
content: Facebook has apologised after it stopped working for users around the world for several hours.

title: Windows 11
content: Windows 11, the latest version of Microsoft's computer operating system, launches worldwide on Tuesday as a free upgrade for Windows 10 users.

title: Amazon
content: Amazon is expanding its presence on the High Street by opening its first non-food store in the UK. It's called Amazon 4-star, because every item has been given more than four stars by customers.

title: Google
content: The top entry on Microsoft's Bing search engine is for its rival Google. The claim was made in court, as Google made its case to appeal against a €4.3bn ($5bn) fine from the European Union for abusing its market power.

title: Quantum Physics
content: Scientists are one step closer to error-correcting quantum computers. Multiple quantum bits were combined into one ‘logical qubit’ to detect mistakes.

title: Health & Medicine
content: Discovering how we sense temperature and touch wins the 2021 medicine Nobel Prize.

title: Chemistry
content: Chemists Benjamin List and David MacMillan have sparked a whole new field that’s aided drug discovery and made chemistry more environmentally friendly.

title: Earth
content: A magnetic field reversal 42,000 years ago may have contributed to mass extinctions. The weakening of Earth's magnetic field correlates with a cascade of environmental crises.

title: Health & Medicine
content: A new antiviral pill cuts COVID-19 hospitalization and death rates. Merck says its drug, molnupiravir, stops viral replication and can be taken right after a COVID-19 diagnosis.

title: Neuroscience
content: High levels of a key blood protein point to brain shrinkage and damage to message-sending axons, providing a biomarker for TBI severity and prognosis.

title: Art in America
content: Guadalupe Maravilla wins $100,000 Lise Wilhelmsen Award, one of the world’s largest art prizes.

title: Market
content: Online art investment platform Masterworks gets boost from investors and $1 B. valuation.

title: Creative Economy
content: If passed, Bipartisan bill offers $300 M. in grants for artists and public arts programming.

title: Market
content: Muhammad Ali’s little-known art becomes a hit on the auction block. A work by the athlete sold for a record-setting $425,000.

title: Artists
content: How I Made This: Victoria Dugger’s alternative cosmologies. According to artist Victoria Dugger, making art feels a bit like chasing the proverbial unicorn.

title: Auctions
content: Botticelli ‘Man of Sorrows’ expected to fetch $40M. Following the record-setting $92 million sale of a Sandro Botticelli painting last year, Sotheby’s is bringing another 15th-century portrait by the Renaissance artist to the auction block.
